entries.meaning: A young dog, wolf, fox, seal, bat or shark, or the young of certain other animals.
examples: The dog has had that bed since he was just a pup.
The new teacher is a mere pup.

entries.meaning: Any cute dog, regardless of age.
examples: My pup likes to run as fast as he can, yet cannot always stop in time!

entries.meaning: A short semi-trailer used jointly with a dolly and another semi-trailer to create a twin trailer.
(horticulture) A new plant growing from a shoot that can be used for propagation.
(film, television) A kind of small spotlight.
examples: For a scene like the Highgate exhumation night sequence suitable equipment would consist of: two brutes on Molevators, three 10 K lights also on Molevators and, for good measure, two 5 Ks, four 2 Ks, two pups (1000 W), two North lights  [â€¦]

entries.meaning: (chiefly US, newspapers, publishing) An early edition of a periodical publication, intended for distribution to distant locations.

verbs.description: pup (third-person singular simple present pups, present participle pupping, simple past and past participle pupped)
